result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger Reyheart

records.addlTxt:
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 
Defendant Roger Reyheart appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Roger Reyheart.  Attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests a date for plea and sentencing.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roger Reyheart appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Roger Reyheart.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Attorney Harris has received discovery and an offer. Defendant is in treatment. Court removes 10/3/2022 date. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Treatment progress report, filed by defense

Defendant Roger Reyheart in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense requests an adjourned date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room 635 Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roger Reyheart in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roger Reyheart in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roger Reyheart in court in person with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris who appears by video.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Roger Reyheart in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant Roger Reyheart in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Roger Reyheart in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Roger Reyheart appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
